artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Kanagaki Robun; Publisher: Kakumotoya Kinjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), nos. 5, 23; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 300.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: unattached triptych; head and bound hands of male figure visible within the spray of a massive waterfall at C; rock face at L; two ethereal figures floating at UR; white pigment flecks
dimension: 14 7/8 × 10 1/8 in. (37.78 × 25.72 cm) (image, sheet, vertical oban triptych; each sheet)
markings: Artist’s seal R, L: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Censor seals R, L: 申六改 | C: 未十改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: R: 玉桜芳年筆 {Gyokuō Yoshitoshi hitsu} | C: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu} |  L: 芳年筆 {Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Picture of Penance under the Waterfall at Mount Nachi
